gravity_system: Pre-engineered Wood Roof Trusses, Wood Stud Walls, Continuous Concrete Strip Footings
other_materials: Plywood, Prefinished Metal Cladding, Rigid Insulation
key_elements: Shearwalls, Roof Truss Bracing, Prefinished Metal Cladding, Continuous Strip Footings
overall_building_description: The Vleuten 50' x 90' Shed is engineered with a robust structural framework, emphasizing load path efficiency and lateral stability. The foundation system comprises continuous concrete strip footings reinforced with 15M rebar, ensuring adequate bearing capacity on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill as per geotechnical recommendations. The foundation walls are constructed with 8" concrete, reinforced with 15M verticals spaced at 48" o.c., and horizontal bars at the top and grade levels, providing a solid base for load transfer. The P.T. sill plate, anchored with 1/2" diameter bolts at 48" o.c., serves as the interface between the foundation and the superstructure, facilitating shear transfer and lateral stability. The superstructure is characterized by pre-engineered wood roof trusses, aligned directly above wood stud walls, ensuring efficient load distribution. The trusses are braced with continuous 2x6 X-bracing, fastened to the top side of the bottom chord, enhancing lateral stability and diaphragm action. Truss uplift clips, specified per manufacturerâ€™s drawings, secure the trusses to the double top plate, mitigating uplift forces. The roof system incorporates prefinished metal roofing, fascia, and vented soffit, providing weather resistance and aesthetic appeal. The wall assemblies, detailed as WE1 and WE2, consist of 2x6 wood studs at 24" o.c., clad with 29 Ga. prefinished metal and insulated with Rockwool batt insulation (R22 min.), ensuring thermal efficiency. Shearwalls, integral to the lateral system, are constructed with 1/2" plywood fastened with 2-3/8" nail-gun nails at 4" o.c. along panel edges and 12" o.c. in the field, supported by 3-ply stud posts at each end. The shearwall detail, referenced as 3/S2.0, includes L5x3x1/4" angles with 5/8" diameter hooked anchors into the concrete foundation, providing robust lateral load resistance. The assembly schedule specifies slab on grade construction with 6" concrete slabs over compacted granular fill, incorporating vapor barriers and insulation for thermal performance. The lintel schedule details various lintel configurations, including LVL and W10x22 options, ensuring adequate support over openings. The building elevations, oriented to the cardinal directions, feature prefinished metal cladding and fascia, with concrete foundations visible at the base, providing a cohesive exterior finish. The construction details emphasize precision in joint configurations, reinforcement layouts, and anchor bolt patterns, ensuring compliance with design criteria and performance requirements. The fabrication notes highlight the necessity for P.Eng. stamped shop drawings for truss systems, ensuring adherence to engineering standards and specifications. The assembly sequences prioritize the installation of bracing and trusses, with temporary bracing requirements outlined to maintain structural integrity during construction. Special conditions, such as site-specific requirements and environmental considerations, are addressed to ensure the successful execution of the project.
